topic: How memory works in the brain
system_prompt: Maximum information density. No filler words, no elaboration, no examples unless essential. Short sentences. Telegram style. Every word must earn its place. If you can cut a word without losing meaning, cut it.
user_prompt: Write about: How memory works in the brain
generated_text:
Memory formation: neural connections strengthened by repeated activity. 
Synaptic plasticity: changes in strength of connections between neurons.
Hebbian rule: "neurons that fire together, wire together".
Consolidation: long-term storage of memories through synaptic pruning and strengthening.
Decay: gradual loss of memories over time due to neuronal death or disuse.
Reconsolidation: updating of stored memories in response to new information.
Emotional arousal: enhances memory formation and retrieval.
Spaced repetition: optimal learning through review at increasingly longer intervals.
